name: Japanese Sweet Potato (Dessert)
description: When the fall season rolls in, this twice-baked Japanese Sweet Potato dessert brings a¬†nostalgic memory to many Japanese. We mash the baked flesh and broil it in its own shell for a unique presentation. Sweet and creamy, it makes a delicious autumn dessert or snack.

video.description:
When fall season rolls in, this popular Japanese dessert ‚ÄúSweet Potato‚Äù brings a nostalgic memory to many Japanese. Double baked in the oven, the mashed sweet potato dessert is served in its own shell for a unique presentation. It‚Äôs sweet and creamy and makes a wonderful autumn dessert! 

RECIPE starts ‚ñ∂ 00:49

PRINT RECIPE ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/JapaneseSweetPotato

Prep Time: 30 mins
Cook Time: 1 hr 15 mins
Total Time: 1 hr 45 mins
Servings: 5 sweet potatoes

INGREDIENTS

3 Japanese sweet potatoes (total weight is 800 g, 1.8 lb)
2 Tbsp unsalted butter (30 g)
5 Tbsp sugar (66 g)
2 egg yolks
‚Öì cup heavy (whipping) cream (75 ml)
¬Ω tsp vanilla extract
1 egg yolk
¬Ω tsp black sesame seeds (roasted/toasted)

INSTRUCTIONS with step-by-step pics ‚ñ∂ http://bit.ly/JapaneseSweetPotato

How to Make Japanese Sweet Potato (Recipe) „Çπ„Ç§„Éº„Éà„Éù„ÉÜ„Éà„ÅÆ‰Ωú„ÇäÊñπ („É¨„Ç∑„Éî)

recipeIngredient: 5 Tbsp sugar ((to keep the sweet potatoes natural yellow color, use granulated sugar instead of other sugars such as brown sugar))
1  large egg yolk ((the egg yolk acts as a binder as well as additional rich yellow color and custardy taste))

recipeInstructions.text: Gather all the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375¬∫F (190¬∫C). For a convection oven, reduce cooking temperature by 25¬∫F (15¬∫C).
recipeInstructions.name: Gather all the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375¬∫F (190¬∫C). For a convection oven, reduce cooking temperature by 25¬∫F (15¬∫C).

recipeInstructions.text: Wash 3 Japanese sweet potatoes (Satsumaimo) carefully (the skin is edible and very nutritious) under running water. Pat dry with a paper towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Wash 3 Japanese sweet potatoes (Satsumaimo) carefully (the skin is edible and very nutritious) under running water. Pat dry with a paper towel.

recipeInstructions.text: Wrap each sweet potato with a sheet of aluminum foil. Poke a few holes in the potatoes with a skewer (for steam to escape).
recipeInstructions.name: Wrap each sweet potato with a sheet of aluminum foil. Poke a few holes in the potatoes with a skewer (for steam to escape).

recipeInstructions.text: Put the sweet potatoes in the oven and bake for 50‚Äì60 minutes, or until the inserted skewer goes through all the way.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the sweet potatoes in the oven and bake for 50‚Äì60 minutes, or until the inserted skewer goes through all the way.

recipeInstructions.text: Carefully open the aluminum foil and cut the sweet potato in half lengthwise.  Make sure not to tear the skin.
recipeInstructions.name: Carefully open the aluminum foil and cut the sweet potato in half lengthwise.  Make sure not to tear the skin.

recipeInstructions.text: While it‚Äôs hot, scoop out the flesh with a spoon, leaving a ¬º-inch (5-mm) wall around the edges to create a shell. We use the shells to stuff the sweet potato pure√© later on, so be careful not to break the wall. You will only use the 5 best-looking shells out of 6.
recipeInstructions.name: While it‚Äôs hot, scoop out the flesh with a spoon, leaving a ¬º-inch (5-mm) wall around the edges to create a shell. We use the shells to stuff the sweet potato pure√© later on, so be careful not to break the wall. You will only use the 5 best-looking shells out of 6.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the sweet potato flesh onto a fine-mesh sieve and strain the flesh by pressing it with a wooden spatula. Alternatively, you can put the flesh in a food processor and make a pure√© (you may need to add a tiny bit of water if the sweet potato flesh is too dense).
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the sweet potato flesh onto a fine-mesh sieve and strain the flesh by pressing it with a wooden spatula. Alternatively, you can put the flesh in a food processor and make a pure√© (you may need to add a tiny bit of water if the sweet potato flesh is too dense).

recipeInstructions.text: Continue with the rest of the sweet potatoes. Collect the strained pure√©d sweet potato in a bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Continue with the rest of the sweet potatoes. Collect the strained pure√©d sweet potato in a bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium saucepan, heat 2 Tbsp unsalted butter over medium-low heat. Once the butter is completely melted, add the pure√©d sweet potato.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium saucepan, heat 2 Tbsp unsalted butter over medium-low heat. Once the butter is completely melted, add the pure√©d sweet potato.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 5 Tbsp sugar and mix well together.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 5 Tbsp sugar and mix well together.

recipeInstructions.text: Then, add 2 large egg yolks one at a time and quickly incorporate into the sweet potato mixture so the egg doesn‚Äôt become cooked and scrambled. Keep stirring.
recipeInstructions.name: Then, add 2 large egg yolks one at a time and quickly incorporate into the sweet potato mixture so the egg doesn‚Äôt become cooked and scrambled. Keep stirring.

recipeInstructions.text: Gradually add ‚Öì cup heavy (whipping) cream, stirring continuously, and combine well with the mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Gradually add ‚Öì cup heavy (whipping) cream, stirring continuously, and combine well with the mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Add ¬Ω tsp pure vanilla extract and mix until the mixture is smooth and creamy. If the mixture turns into a big lump and not the silky texture, you can add more melted butter and/or heavy cream to loosen up. Turn off the heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add ¬Ω tsp pure vanilla extract and mix until the mixture is smooth and creamy. If the mixture turns into a big lump and not the silky texture, you can add more melted butter and/or heavy cream to loosen up. Turn off the heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Scoop the mixture into the sweet potato shells. I use a cookie dough scooper to make the job easier (this is great for portion control, too).
recipeInstructions.name: Scoop the mixture into the sweet potato shells. I use a cookie dough scooper to make the job easier (this is great for portion control, too).

recipeInstructions.text: Using an offset spatula (or a silicone spatula), smooth out the surface of the filling, creating a gentle slope in the center of the sweet potatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: Using an offset spatula (or a silicone spatula), smooth out the surface of the filling, creating a gentle slope in the center of the sweet potatoes.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the sweet potato shells on a baking sheet lined with a sheet of parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the sweet potato shells on a baking sheet lined with a sheet of parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, whisk 1 large egg yolk and brush the egg wash on the sweet potato mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, whisk 1 large egg yolk and brush the egg wash on the sweet potato mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle ¬Ω tsp toasted black sesame seeds on the center of each sweet potato.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle ¬Ω tsp toasted black sesame seeds on the center of each sweet potato.

recipeInstructions.text: Position the rack in the middle of the oven. Broil on Medium (500¬∫F/250¬∫C) for 3‚Äì4 minutes, or until the top starts to brown a little bit.
recipeInstructions.name: Position the rack in the middle of the oven. Broil on Medium (500¬∫F/250¬∫C) for 3‚Äì4 minutes, or until the top starts to brown a little bit.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the oven and serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from the oven and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: These are so delicious! Can they be prepared in advance and then broiled last minute for serving?
Best sweet potato recipe! As always, I really appreciate Nami's detailed recipes!
I made these yesterday and they are incredibly delicious! No complaints here, thank you for the lovely recipe!
